chargeHist.descr: Burglary of a Building or Dwelling

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Burglary of a Building or Dwelling

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony M Jordan

records.addlTxt:
Renumbering Count 2 to Count 1. 
Adding Count 2- Criminal Damage to Property as Party to a Crime.
Notice of Hearing, Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Insufficient Address, Unable to Forward

2:30 PM case called and held via Zoom. Defendant Anthony M Jordan appeared by video, in custody in Dunn County.  Attorney Michael J Steuer in court for Anthony M Jordan.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. State calls detective Erl to testify- is sworn and testifies. Record to reflect identification of the defendant by detective Erl. 
Cross examination by the Defense. Witness is released. State asks for bind over. Court binds matter over for ARGN in Branch 2.
Preliminary hearing on October 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(Case called at 2:01 PM) No appearance by Defendant Anthony Jordan. Attorney Michael J Steuer in court for Anthony M Jordan.  Attorney Andrew J. Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates the Defendant is in custody in Dunn county- not sure why he was not transported. State requests adjournment as witness is not available. 
Court finds good cause to continue Preliminary Hearing. 
Preliminary Hearing: 10/18/2022 at 2:00 PM.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Anthony M Jordan
Current: 1015 Blazing Star Blvd, Altoona, WI 54720 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)
Prior: 6146 Kingsfont Pl, Florissant, MO 63033
Preliminary hearing on October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(Case called at 11:15 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Anthony Jordan appears in custody via video conference from the Dunn County Jail without counsel. ADA Tiffany Winter appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of the complaint, updates phone number, and address. Defendant is seeking counsel. State requests $50,000 cash bond. Defendant requests lower bond. Court orders $25,000 cash bond with various conditions. 
Preliminary Hearing: 10/11/2022 at 2:00 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with M.J. (co-defendant), Mac Man, M.O.
No violent/abusive contact or acts/threats of violence toward anyone.
